title: How to Change the Number Format on a Mac

steps.title: Click on the Apple menu.
steps.content: Click on the Apple menu. It's the black, apple-shaped icon in the upper-left of your screen.

steps.title: Click on Language & Region.
steps.content: Click on Language & Region . It's at the top of the preferences window. Click on ⋮⋮⋮⋮ in the top bar of the dialog box if you don't see all the system preferences icons.

steps.title: Click on Advanced.
steps.content: Click on Advanced . It's in the lower right corner.

steps.title: Click on the drop-down menu next to "Grouping."
steps.content: Click on the drop-down menu next to "Grouping."

steps.title: Click on a separator.
steps.content: Click on a separator. You can choose from a comma, period, apostrophe, space, or none, to select how the system will format larger numbers like 1,000,000.

steps.title: Click on the drop-down menu next to "Decimal."
steps.content: Click on the drop-down menu next to "Decimal."

steps.title: Click on a separator.
steps.content: Click on a separator. You can choose from a comma or period to select how the system will format numbers with decimals.

steps.title: Click on the drop-down menu next to "Measurement Units."
steps.content: Click on the drop-down menu next to "Measurement Units."

steps.title: Click on a system of measurement.
steps.content: Click on a system of measurement. You can choose from Metric, U.K., or U.S. You have now changed the number format on your Mac.

steps.title: Click on the Apple menu.
steps.content: Click on the Apple menu. It's the black, apple-shaped icon in the upper-left of your screen.

steps.title: Click on Keyboard.
steps.content: Click on Keyboard . It's near the center of the preferences window. If you don't see all of the System Preferences icons, click on ⋮⋮⋮⋮ in the top bar of the dialog box.

steps.title: Click on Input Sources.
steps.content: Click on Input Sources . It's near the top of the dialog box.

steps.title: Click on +.
steps.content: Click on + . It's below the pane on the left side of the dialog box.

steps.title: Click on a number/language format.
steps.content: Click on a number/language format. They're listed alphabetically by language in the left pane of the dialog box.

steps.title: Click on Add.
steps.content: Click on Add . You've now changed the number format to that of the corresponding language. For example, if you select Bengali, the number keys will display Bengali characters. Check the box next to "Show input menu in menu bar," at the bottom of the dialog box, so you can toggle between number formats and keyboard languages.
